name: Grant Proposal Template
description: Comprehensive academic grant proposal template for NSF, NIH, and other funding agencies with professional formatting and detailed sections
author: Document Writer Extension

variables.name: projectTitle
variables.placeholder: e.g., Advanced Machine Learning Approaches for Climate Prediction

variables.name: fundingAgency
variables.placeholder: e.g., National Science Foundation (NSF)

variables.name: fundingOpportunity
variables.placeholder: e.g., NSF-23-545: Computer and Information Science and Engineering

variables.name: principalInvestigator
variables.placeholder: e.g., Dr. Jane Smith, Professor of Computer Science

variables.name: institution
variables.placeholder: e.g., University of Technology

variables.name: department
variables.placeholder: e.g., Department of Computer Science

variables.name: projectPeriod
variables.placeholder: e.g., 3 years (September 2024 - August 2027)

variables.name: submissionDate
variables.placeholder: Current date will be used if not specified

variables.name: executiveSummary
variables.description: Executive summary of the project (2-3 paragraphs)
variables.placeholder: Concise overview of the research project, its objectives, methodology, and expected impact. Should be compelling and accessible to both technical and non-technical reviewers.

variables.name: projectSignificance
variables.description: Significance and importance of the project
variables.placeholder: Explain why this research is important, timely, and needed. Address broader impacts and potential contributions to the field.

variables.name: expectedImpact
variables.description: Expected impact and outcomes of the research
variables.placeholder: Describe the anticipated scientific, technological, economic, or societal impacts of the research.

variables.name: backgroundSignificance
variables.placeholder: Comprehensive background information, context, and significance of the research problem. Include current state of the field and knowledge gaps.

variables.name: primaryObjective
variables.placeholder: Main goal or objective of the research project. Should be specific, measurable, and achievable.

variables.name: secondaryObjectives
variables.placeholder: Supporting objectives that contribute to the primary goal. Use bullet points or numbered list format.

variables.name: researchHypotheses
variables.placeholder: Specific, testable hypotheses that will guide the research. Should be falsifiable and clearly stated.

variables.name: literatureReview
variables.placeholder: Comprehensive review of relevant literature, citing key studies and identifying research gaps. Demonstrate thorough knowledge of the field.

variables.name: theoreticalFramework
variables.placeholder: Theoretical foundations, models, or frameworks that inform the research approach and methodology.

variables.name: studyDesign
variables.placeholder: Overall research design, methodology type (quantitative, qualitative, mixed-methods), and justification for the chosen approach.

variables.name: dataCollection
variables.placeholder: Detailed description of data collection methods, instruments, sampling procedures, and data sources.

variables.name: analysisPlan
variables.description: Data analysis plan and statistical methods
variables.placeholder: Statistical and analytical methods to be used, software tools, and analysis procedures. Include power analysis if applicable.

variables.name: timelineMilestones
variables.placeholder: Detailed timeline showing major phases, activities, milestones, and deliverables across the project period.

variables.name: grandTotal
variables.description: Grand total budget for all years

variables.name: budgetJustification
variables.placeholder: Comprehensive justification for each budget category, explaining costs and their necessity for the project.

variables.name: evaluationMethodology
variables.placeholder: Methods for evaluating project success, including metrics, benchmarks, and assessment procedures.

variables.name: disseminationPlan
variables.placeholder: Strategy for sharing results through publications, conferences, workshops, and other dissemination channels.

variables.name: researchTeam
variables.placeholder: Detailed information about team members, their qualifications, roles, and contributions to the project.

variables.name: institutionalResources
variables.placeholder: Description of institutional facilities, resources, support services, and commitments available for the project.

variables.name: expectedOutcomes
variables.placeholder: Specific outcomes, deliverables, and impacts expected from the research, including publications, patents, software, etc.

variables.name: riskManagement
variables.placeholder: Identification of potential risks and challenges with corresponding mitigation strategies and contingency plans.

variables.name: references
variables.placeholder: Complete bibliography of all sources cited in the proposal, formatted according to the funding agency's requirements.

variables.name: principalInvestigatorCV
variables.placeholder: Comprehensive CV of the Principal Investigator, including education, experience, publications, and relevant qualifications.

variables.name: coInvestigatorCVs
variables.placeholder: CVs of all co-investigators and key personnel involved in the project.

variables.name: lettersOfSupport
variables.placeholder: Letters of support from collaborators, institutions, industry partners, or other stakeholders.

variables.name: additionalDocuments
variables.placeholder: Any additional documents required by the funding agency, such as facilities descriptions, data management plans, etc.

sections.name: Title Page
sections.description: Professional cover page with project information, PI details, and funding request

sections.name: Executive Summary
sections.description: Concise overview of the project, significance, and expected impact

sections.name: Project Description
sections.description: Comprehensive description including background, objectives, literature review, and theoretical framework

sections.name: Research Methodology
sections.description: Detailed methodology including study design, data collection, analysis plan, and timeline

sections.name: Budget
sections.description: Complete budget breakdown with professional table format and detailed justification

sections.name: Evaluation and Dissemination Plan
sections.description: Plans for evaluating success and disseminating results

sections.name: Research Team and Qualifications
sections.description: Team member qualifications and their roles in the project

sections.name: Institutional Resources and Support
sections.description: Available institutional facilities and support for the project

sections.name: Expected Outcomes and Impact
sections.description: Anticipated outcomes, deliverables, and broader impacts

sections.name: Appendices
sections.description: Supporting documents including CVs, letters of support, and additional materials

styling.table: professional with shaded headers and borders
styling.spacing: academic formatting with proper section breaks

usageInstructions: Complete all required variables before generating the document
Budget amounts should include currency symbols (e.g., $500,000)
Use academic writing style appropriate for grant proposals
Ensure literature review includes current and relevant citations
Follow specific funding agency guidelines for page limits and formatting
Include detailed budget justification for all requested funds
Provide comprehensive methodology that demonstrates feasibility
Address broader impacts and societal benefits of the research
Include contingency plans for potential challenges or setbacks
Ensure all team member qualifications align with project requirements
Letters of support should be from credible and relevant sources
Follow proper citation format required by the funding agency

fundingAgencyGuidelines.NSF: Follows NSF proposal guidelines including broader impacts criteria
fundingAgencyGuidelines.NIH: Structured for NIH R01 and similar research grants
fundingAgencyGuidelines.DOE: Appropriate for Department of Energy research proposals
fundingAgencyGuidelines.Generic: Adaptable template suitable for various funding agencies

academicStandards.citations: Academic citation style with comprehensive bibliography
academicStandards.writing: Formal academic writing appropriate for research proposals
academicStandards.structure: Standard grant proposal structure following best practices
